Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Risky \Risk"y\, a. Attended with risk or danger; hazardous. ``A risky matter.'' --W. Collins. [1913 Webster]
Generalization are always risky. --Lowell. [1913 Webster]

risky adj 1: involving risk or danger; "skydiving is a hazardous sport"; "extremely risky going out in the tide and fog"; "a venturesome journey in wintertime"; "a venturous enterprise" [syn: {hazardous}, {venturesome}, {venturous}] 2: not financially safe or secure; "a bad investment"; "high risk investments"; "anything that promises to pay too much can't help being risky"; "speculative business enterprises" [syn: {bad}, {insecure}, {high-risk}, {speculative}] [also: {riskiest}, {riskier}]
